With a population of about 100,000 (105,661 at the 2020 census), it is one of the larger suburbs on the San Francisco Peninsula, located between Burlingame to the north, Foster City to the east, Belmont to the south, and Highlands-Baywood Park and Hillsborough to the west. San Mateo was incorporated in 1864. == References == ==Other websites== Category:Cities in California Category:1864 establishments in California Category:Cities in the San Francisco Bay Area Category:Settlements in San Mateo County, California
title: San Mateo, California
